snippet: The state Supreme Court had ordered lawmakers to increase aid to poor schools, but the session ended without a consensus on what to do.
abstract: Republican leaders of supermajorities in Kansas Legislature debate whether to comply with state Supreme Court's order to increase aid to poor school districts on final day of annual session; lawmakers adjourn after no consensus is reached.
lead_paragraph: The state Supreme Court had ordered lawmakers to increase aid to poor schools, but the session ended without a consensus on what to do.

headline.main: Kansas Lawmakers End Session Without Decision on School Funding
headline.print_headline: Kansas Legislators End Session Without a School Funding Plan
